summary: The documents pertain to the creation and dissemination of an Identi-Kit composite of James Earl Ray in April 1968, following the assassination of Martin Luther King Jr. The composite was requested by Richard Ober of CI/OP/DO and constructed using a specific code prior to the arrival of photographs. The documents highlight specific details about Ray's appearance, such as the omission of a forehead scar due to an unknown location and the protrusion of his left ear. The composite was intended for use in identifying and locating Ray.
significance: In the context of the JFK assassination documents, the composite refers to an Identi-Kit composite of James Earl Ray, who assassinated Martin Luther King Jr. The creation and dissemination of this composite were crucial for identifying and apprehending Ray, highlighting the efforts made by various agencies to track down individuals involved in significant events.
